instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: 820-00850 with CD3215s repeatedly failing
threads.message: I have a 2019 MacBook Pro board 820-00850 that came in unresponsive. A DFU Restore seemed to fix the issue and the machine was up and running. Several days later, the machine suddenly was stuck at 5V USB-C and I found that two CD3215s were dead (U3200 & UB300). I replaced them and the machine was running again. Then, another week later the machine was returned to me unresponsive again and the same two CD3215s appear to have died. What could cause this repeated failure?

threads.title: 820-00850 with CD3215s repeatedly failing
threads.message: The client uses chinese clone charger?

threads.title: 820-00850 with CD3215s repeatedly failing
threads.message: Yes, it was a non-Apple charger.
